title: If yasuo is hard to play or master, Why does he have the highest play rate with a 54% win rate
body:
Im legimately asking. No offence to any yas player or anything.

I mean you'd think a hard champion wouldnt have the highest play rate... You know? Just like being a doctor is more rare than being a nurse...


And even if thats fine having the highest play rate, why would he also have a 54% win rate :X.... Shouldnt the #1 played champ thats supposedly hard.... Have a lower win rate..?

replies.body:
He's not hard to play.
He's hard to master.
His skillfloor is practically non-existent.
His skillceiling is fairly high.

The reason he's doing so well was because of his cancerous tank Yasuo build + the ultimate bug.

The reason he's played so often is because he's flashy, and people think abusing the low skillfloor without actually being good at Yasuo makes them good, by the nature of Yasuo's abilities all looking flashy.

>His skillfloor is practically non-existent.

yeah no. His skill floor is there. Its higher than a fair amount of champions. 

>His skillceiling is fairly high.

his skillfloor is considerably higher than most champions. So if you change those then i can agree with you
by going tank yasuo his skillfloor is basically removed.
THat's why it got nerfed duh
He's still pretty much the easiest non beggining (Annie, Warwick, Yi etc.) champion. The problem is that he doesn't fall off with higher elo, he's practically the same.

Agreed. People like him because he can make an impact just by spamming e. Confusing the piss out of someone in lane or a whole team in a team fight is a viable strategy and in yasou's kit he can do this with absolutely no skill by spamming e. And he has a refreshing (passive, so doesn't take skill either) shield. So basically his e and his passive are what make him easy to pick up and play. 

The rest of his key takes skill and is viable in my opinion. I don't get mad when I get hit by the gust and ulted because it was my fault for not dodging it and in reality it was just him out playing me. 

But when I get a headache watching him e around with no apparent strategy and can't kill him even though I can tell he is bad/new with yasou that's what makes his skill floor so incredibly high. 

To sum it up, very few champions have the ability to make such a huge impact simply by point and clicking with low cool down. I always ban yas because I know that regardless of my opponent's skill level yasou will have an impact and to me that just seems broken.

Several reasons:

1.  There was a bug last patch with his ult

2.  People are abusing a build that essentially covers the risk associated with Yasuo (I can do damage and survive because I'm tanky and I have high crit)

3.  There's a psychological aspect for those who hate Yasuo. When they see Yasuo, they're instantly tilted and start playing worse than they usually play. This is more my opinion, but it makes sense to me.

4.  People don't put forth effort in actually trying to play around his weaknesses rather than his strengths.

>There's a psychological aspect for those who hate Yasuo. When they see Yasuo, they're instantly tilted and start playing worse than they usually play. This is more my opinion, but it makes sense to me.

As someone who suffers from this, I can confirm that this is a thing.

While this is indeed a thing I offer you a solution that works for me. Yasuo's hard counters counter him really bad. My go-to pick is Irelia, but there are some other who works as well. So if I happen to lane against him and have the luxury of counterpicking I pick Irelia and make his life a fckin hell. Once an enemy Yasuo rage-quited when being 0/6. The main thing was that his CS was the same as when he was 0/2. He died 4 times without taking a single CS - the moment I saw him in lane - I instantly killed him. And if one had  asked: "is it worth to burn a flash/other spells to tower-dive a 0/5 player, who gives close to 0 gold and is not going to be relevant the whole game anyways" - the answer is "to make Yasuo's life miserable - hell YEAH it's worth!!!"

I do everything I can to make them miserable when possible.  Whenever I saw him going top, I go to Voli, run him down top lane like the filthy animal he is, bite his head off under the tier 2 turret, and after the fourth or fifth kill, bathe in the tears...delicious tears.  And when I'm not zoning him out of farm, I make it my mission to target him in teamfights, flashing over three champions just to get to him and watch him frantically try to scramble away from me only to get his head bitten off again.  If it wasn't still season 6, I'd almost be tempted to queue top...almost.

But as far as the solution thing goes,  I'm ADC / Jungle primary, so I'm not laning against him much so I can't really counter him like that, and then even if I do, I'm still tilted from champ select regardless of the situation.

This reads like you should be saying this to a psychiatrist...

Second for full assassin yasuo. Because to go in it not to go in isn't a meaningful champion distinct decision. I just don't see where he makes many meaningful champion specific decisions

 Engaging, positioning, targeting, etc are game based that all champions make regardless of kit.
Annie has a much simpler kit but similar play pattern. She charges up her stun/yasuos knock up. Then engages with that cc and her ult. At that point you either disengage and try to survive or try to dish out as much damage as possible.

Windwall this ability or save it? 
EQ this person or that person?

As a yasuo main with 100k points, time to correct


"windwall this ability or save it" you usually never have this in mind

"EQ this person or that person" you dont need to be a certain champ to think this, such as zeds "do I ult adc or support"

"should i ult or not" too basic knowledge, not viable

Looked at your profile and with that loosing streak it seems like you're tilted. Good luck with that. (Offtopic)

1)Ww: It does matter actually. If your wall gets baited you're pretty much done with a jhin ults or something similar. 

2) You don't always get to reach the adc without getting cc'd so it is a decision making to take the risk of trying to reach the adc (if there are even minions around) or not. 

3) It can be basic knowledge, but sometimes even when things look like a perfect ult it's not always the best idea to go in. 

Overall against crap players in bronze-silver yasuo doesn't take too much decision making  (You need some but not intensive ones) against good players he does. It's somewhat why yasuo isn't P/B in lcs.

I'll be honest. Being good at yasuo doesn't mean that you think these things through.

Being good at him entails making these decisions unconsciously

Like I referenced with the renekton and Rengar they have to make a decision about what empowered ability to use. That decision is unique to that champion. Whether to go in or not as you are stating with yasuo is not champion specific. Alistar makes that same decision, do I engage? Do I flank? Do I peel etc. It's not kit unique.

If say for example with a full flow you could either get shielded, windwall, or knock up. At that point you are giving up some power for power somewhere else. That is where the term skill floor and ceiling mostly come from.
